LiFePO 4/C (2–3 wt.% carbon) powder (LFP) is provided by Hydro-Québec, Varennes, Canada. The protocol for the surface modification of LFP with aryl-COOH groups is similar to that for carbon. The reaction, however, is performed in acetonitrile because the LFP slowly reacts with water and is unstable in an acidic medium
